title: 1972) and for the purposes of giving effect to full effect to Regulation (EU) No.
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Communities (Cross
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Communities (Cross 

Border Payments) (Amendment) Regulations 2025.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited european community (cross border payments) (amendment) regulation 2025

title: 1972) and for the purposes of giving effect to full effect to Regulation (EU) No.
heading: 2. The European Communities (Cross Border Payments) Regulations 2010
text_raw:
2. The European Communities (Cross Border Payments) Regulations 2010 

(S.I. No. 183 of 2010) are amended – 

(a) 

in Regulation 4(2) by the insertion of “and persons providing 
currency conversion services at an automated teller machine or at 
the point of sale” after “Payment Service Providers”, and 

(b) 

in Regulation 13 – 

(i) 

by the designation of that Regulation as paragraph (1), and 

(ii) by the insertion of the following paragraph after paragraph 

(1): 

“(2) A person (other than a payment service provider) 
who provides currency conversion services at an 
automated teller machine or at the point of sale in 
contravention of Article 4(1), (3), (4) or (7) of the EC 
Cross Border Payments Regulation shall be guilty of an 
offence and shall be liable - 

(a) 

on summary conviction, to a class A fine, or 

(b) on conviction on indictment, to a fine not 

exceeding €100,000.”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

1 September, 2025. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 
Minister for Finance. 

1 OJ No. L274, 30.07.2021, p. 20 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 5th September, 2025.
